com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v4.core

Class JRoutine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gh.bmd.jrt.core.JRoutine
      • com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.core.JRoutine
        • com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v4.core.JRoutine

  • public class JRoutine
extends JRoutine
    This utility class extends the base Java routine in order to support additional routine builders specific to the Android platform.
    Routine invocations created through the returned builders can be safely restored after a change in the configuration, so to avoid duplicated calls and memory leaks. Be aware, though, that the invocation results will be dispatched on the configured looper thread, no matter the calling one was, so that, waiting for the outputs right after the routine invocation, may result in a deadlock.

    Note that the equals() and hashCode() methods of the input parameter objects and the invocation factory arguments, might be employed to check for clashing of invocation instances or compute the loader ID.
    In case the caller cannot guarantee the correct behavior of the aforementioned method implementations, a user defined ID or an input independent clash resolution should be used to avoid unexpected results.

    The routine invocations will be identified by an ID number. In case a clash is detected, that is, an already running invocation with the same ID exists at the time the new invocation is executed, the clash is resolved based on the strategy specified through the builder. When a clash cannot be resolved, for example when invocations with different implementations share the same ID, the new invocation is aborted with a InvocationClashException.

    For example, in order to get a resource from the network, needed to fill an activity UI: 

         

         @Override
         protected void onCreate(final Bundle savedInstanceState) {

             super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
             setContentView(R.layout.my_activity_layout);

             if (savedInstanceState != null) {

                 mResource = savedInstanceState.getParcelable(RESOURCE_KEY);
             }

             if (mResource != null) {

                 displayResource(mResource);

             } else {

                 final Routine<URI, MyResource> routine =
                         JRoutine.onActivity(this, ClassToken.tokenOf(LoadResource.class))
                                 .buildRoutine();
                 routine.callAsync(RESOURCE_URI)
                        .bind(new TemplateOutputConsumer<MyResource>() {

                            @Override
                            public void onError(@Nullable final Throwable error) {

                                displayError(error);
                            }

                            @Override
                            public void onOutput(final MyResource resource) {

                                mResource = resource;
                                displayResource(resource);
                            }
                        });
             }
         }

         @Override
         protected void onSaveInstanceState(final Bundle outState) {

             super.onSaveInstanceState(outState);
             outState.putParcelable(RESOURCE_KEY, mResource);
         }
    The above code will ensure that the loading process survives any configuration change and the resulting resource is dispatched only once.

    Note that the invocation may be implemented so to run in a separate service: 

         

         public class LoadResource extends TemplateContextInvocation<URI, MyResource> {

             private Routine<URI, MyResource> mRoutine;

             @Override
             public void onContext(@Nonnull final Context context) {

                 super.onContext(context);
                 mRoutine = JRoutine.onService(context, ClassToken.tokenOf(LoadResourceUri.class))
                                    .buildRoutine();
             }

             @Override
             public void onInput(final URI uri,
                     @Nonnull final ResultChannel<MyResource> result) {

                 result.pass(mRoutine.callAsync(uri));
             }
         }

    Created by davide-maestroni on 12/8/14.

      static LoaderObjectRoutineBuilder onActivity(FragmentActivity activity, Class<?> target)
      Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified activity, wrapping the specified object instances.
      In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as application.

      Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation in the main thread will result in a deadlock.

    • Method Detail

      • onActivity

        @Nonnull
public static LoaderObjectRoutineBuilder onActivity(@Nonnull
                                            FragmentActivity activity,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            Class<?> target)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified activity, wrapping the specified object instances.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as application.
        Parameters:
        activity - the invocation activity context.
        target - the wrapped object class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • onActivity

        @Nonnull
public static <INPUT,OUTPUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> onActivity(@Nonnull
                                                                   FragmentActivity activity,
                                                                   @Nonnull
                                                                   ContextInvocationFactory<INPUT,OUTPUT> factory)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified activity.
        In order to prevent undesired leaks, the class of the specified factory must be static.
        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation in the main thread will result in a deadlock.
        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        activity - the invocation activity context.
        factory - the invocation factory.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified factory is not static.

      • onActivity

        @Nonnull
public static <INPUT,OUTPUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> onActivity(@Nonnull
                                                                   FragmentActivity activity,
                                                                   @Nonnull
                                                                   ClassToken<? extends ContextInvocation<INPUT,OUTPUT>> token)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified activity.
        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation in the main thread will result in a deadlock.
        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        activity - the invocation activity context.
        token - the invocation class token.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • onActivity

        @Nonnull
public static LoaderChannelBuilder onActivity(@Nonnull
                                      FragmentActivity activity,
                                      int id)
        Returns a builder of an output channel bound to the loader identified by the specified ID.
        Note that, if no invocation with the specified ID is running at the time of the channel creation, the output will be aborted with a InvocationMissingException.
        Parameters:
        activity - the invocation activity context.
        id - the loader ID.
        Returns:
        the channel builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified loader ID is equal to AUTO.

      • onFragment

        @Nonnull
public static LoaderObjectRoutineBuilder onFragment(@Nonnull
                                            Fragment fragment,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            Class<?> target)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified fragment, wrapping the specified object instances.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as application.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the invocation fragment context.
        target - the wrapped object class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • onFragment

        @Nonnull
public static <INPUT,OUTPUT> LoaderRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> onFragment(@Nonnull
                                                                   Fragment fragment,
                                                                   @Nonnull
                                                                   ContextInvocationFactory<INPUT,OUTPUT> factory)
        Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified fragment.
        In order to prevent undesired leaks, the class of the specified factory must be static.
        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation in the main thread will result in a deadlock.
        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the invocation fragment context.
        factory - the invocation factory.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified factory is not static.

      • onFragment

        @Nonnull
public static LoaderChannelBuilder onFragment(@Nonnull
                                      Fragment fragment,
                                      int id)
        Returns a builder of an output channel bound to the loader identified by the specified ID.
        Note that, if no invocation with the specified ID is running at the time of the channel creation, the output will be aborted with a InvocationMissingException.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the invocation fragment context.
        id - the loader ID.
        Returns:
        the channel builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified loader ID is equal to AUTO.
